entry.title: Gods Don't Belong in Gotham
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 119,155Chapters: 16/?Kudos: 1,172

Summary: “Well?” he asked, his voice low.A pause.His eyes dragged over Clark, not with drunken lust but with something sharper.“You here to watch… or join? Might as well make it a threesome.”Clark choked on his own spit so hard he nearly doubled over, coughing. It's been 5 years since both Superman and Batman began their separate crusades. Both curious but cautious.Clark remains in Metropolis, respecting the Dark Knight's strict rule to keep metas out of Gotham. Meanwhile, Bruce is consumed with finding a balance between Batman and Bruce Wayne, determine to not repeat mistakes of the past. But it's hard to do that when he is too stubborn to accept help. Fortunately, for him Clark is just as stubborn.Their paths cross when Clark is sent to cover a gala in Gotham, stepping into the city he's barred from. What begins as a professional obligation turns into an unforgettable collision with Gotham's once reclusive billionaire. Or Clark and Bruce fall for each other slowly yet quickly.

entry.title: Blinding Truth
entry.summary:
Author: Holdt

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 43,548Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 7

Summary: When Bruce Wayne's parents are assassinated for his reform proposals, his uncontrolled spirit-magic nearly kills him. Death-servant Clark abandons his sacred duty to save Bruce's life—condemning a spirit to shadow-eternity and losing his own sight in a failed purification ritual. Now forsaken by his people and able to see only magic and mortality, Clark must keep Bruce's wild power from burning him out while wetlands warriors train them both for revolution. Bruce will return to Gotham to destroy the old guard families who murdered his parents. But first, he has to be worth everything Clark sacrificed.

entry.title: Super Freak
entry.summary:
Author: Holdt

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 23,712Chapters: 6/12Kudos: 26

Summary: They have an arrangement. Eight months of Thursdays. Eight months of Bruce cataloguing everything he tells himself he's not cataloguing — the sounds Clark makes, the impossible heat of him, the way his sleeping body turns toward Bruce's corner of the room. Eight months of very carefully not calling it what it is. Then Clark shows up on a Sunday and asks Bruce what he knows. Turns out Bruce knows exactly what this is. He's known since Kazakhstan, since a restaurant at 3 AM, since Clark said I'd like to come back from this to a bowl of pelmeni and Bruce filed it under highest priority classification and declined to retrieve it. He's retrieving it now. (Or: Bruce Wayne's comprehensive manual on how to be in love with Clark Kent while pretending very hard that you're not, until you can't pretend anymore, at which point you should probably just say it out loud. Featuring: a case, a conspiracy, water rights journalism, one teenager's homemade piezometers, and Bruce Wayne learning that sometimes staying is scarier than any exit he's ever built.)

entry.title: Cryptomnesia
entry.summary:
Author: superguyfan

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,354Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 13

Summary: “Uh hi! Apologies for the intrusion, I’m Clark Kent with the Daily Planet, I just wanted to know if you might give me a quote on the van that attempted to run you and your colleagues over.” “Looks like you pretty much got the gist of it. I gotta thank you for the school teacher cover, it’s giving me an excuse to leave right now.” Clark gave a bewildered look as if he was trying to feign ignorance. “Drop the act. I may have almost been run over but that doesn’t mean I lost my eyes and ears in the process. A school teacher calling a hospital? Really?” Clark fixed his glasses, a small chuckle escaping his lips. “It’s true what they say then, you’re pretty good.” “Not sure if I would call doing my job ‘pretty good,’ but that’s why you’re the reporter and I’m the detective. Now if you’ll excuse me...” Bruce Wayne has it all: a solid career, a family fortune, but what happens when a huge conspiracy falls right into his lap and he suddenly finds himself in a load of trouble and no one but a rookie reporter to help him out?

entry.title: Adoption to Adoration
entry.summary:
Author: Missingjay

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,433Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 60

Summary: Bruce Wayne, interstellar bounty hunter, is trapped in a nightmare. Lost in the depths of space, abducted by aliens and held captive as a mindless beast. Powerless to resist the whims of the aliens or reason with them for his release, he is utterly trapped. Kal-el, a freelance journalist specializing in xenobiology correspondence, is in love. A surly little unclassified mammalian at the shelter he volunteers at has stolen his core. He’s never had a pet before and this creature has a history of servere behavioral problems, but he can’t let the poor thing be euthanized without trying to save it. How hard could exotic pet ownership be.

entry.title: I Know You’re Tired, Well I’m Tired Too
entry.summary:
Author: Kingiic

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 19,602Chapters: 8/30Kudos: 23

Summary: Light, all consuming and wet. The chords of blackness receded from the peripherals of his vision. Nothing remained of the evidence. The beast from seconds ago was nothing more than a literal stain on Gordon’s white button up. And Light; totally absolute in its buzzing heat. Gordon lifted his arm to shield his eyes from the beams. In an instant, the light dulled. Gordon took a moment to rub his eyes and readjust himself before looking at the six-foot bat signal pointing directly at him. Perched on the metal neck, standing just behind the dimmed light, stood the half-illuminated silhouette of the Batman. “We need to talk.” Began the familiar voice, low and stern. “Are you functional?”______________ Someone is making clones of this world’s most powerful individuals, Gotham is battling fascism and corruption in the midst of a mayoral race, and Batman must learn how to fight fire with fire, or else he'll have to make a few new friends.

entry.title: like grey skies (like a bird of paradise)
entry.summary:
Author: rainbow_nerds

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 28,071Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 282

Summary: He sighed to himself and downed the glass of champagne he'd been nursing—non-alcoholic, but enough to convince anyone who might give him a passing glance. He hated this, every time he had to do it. There was one surefire way to derail anyone who began wondering whether maybe Bruce Wayne was doing more than just donating funds to Batman.His tie hung loose around his neck, shirt unbuttoned to halfway down his chest, laughing too easily, pressing close to everyone he spoke to, whispering in ears, playing the part, until he turned and froze on the spot.Clark Kent, in his signature ill-fitting suit, stood holding a notebook and pen, staring at him with barely-concealed glee.Bruce cringed internally. He hated this. He especially hated when it had to be witnessed by someone he actually respected.or: After a Gala, Bruce and Clark end up in bed together. They're friends, just helping each other out, no strings attached. Which would be great, if Bruce hadn't been halfway to head-over-heels since the day they met.

entry.title: The Hand He Knows
entry.summary:
Author: Holdt

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 42,528Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 8

Summary: Bruce Wayne, thirty-one years old, has been keeping a promise he made at eight. This is not a story about Batman. This is a story about the man who puts the cowl on at four in the morning and knows, with the same certainty he brings to everything, exactly why he's doing it — and what it's costing. About a mind that never rests and never forgets and has been running the same circles for twenty-three years. About the list in the drawer that he has not opened and has not deleted. About the thread holding him together. About the hand he knows, and the hand he keeps reaching for, and the specific, irrevocable difference between those two things. A character study in ten movements.
